Description: 'Horae in laudem beatissimae virginis Mariae, ad usum Romanum' (Lyon, Mathias Bonhomme for Guillame Rouille) 1548; Latin Book of Hours printed in red and black ink; each page is enframed by elaborate ornamental woodcut frame, including putti, grotesques, masks, ships, women, sphinxes, bucrania, vegetal motifs, abstract ornament, landscapes, and shields; several frames signed PV; title page with woodcut of virgin and child; 14 metalcuts designed by Hans Holbein and signed IF (Jacob Faber?) depicting: the Martyrdom of St. John, Betrayal of Christ, Miracle of St. Bernard, Virgin and St. Anne, Nativity, Annunciation to the Shepherds, Adoration of Three Magi, Presentation in the Temple, Flight into Egypt, Ascension of the Virgin, Crucifixion, Mary Queen of Heaven, David Praying, and the Raising of Lazarus; with later leather binding and wedding scene embossed on the cover. 1548 Woodcut, metalcut, and letterpress
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (110) (a-n)
Acquisition name: Donated through: Art Fund (presented anonymously through the Art Fund)
